text:
Raskolnikov glanced at the curtain. 

The old woman entered, eyes sharp. 

“What do you want?” she asked. 

“I’ve brought something to pawn.” 

He revealed an old silver watch. 

“The time is up for your last pledge,” she said. 

“I’ll bring the interest. Wait a little.” 

“That’s for me to decide,” she replied. 

“How much for the watch, Alyona Ivanovna?” 

“Trifles,” she scoffed. “I gave you two roubles for your ring.” 

“Give me four roubles. It was my father’s.” 

“A rouble and a half, interest in advance.” 

“A rouble and a half!” he shouted. 

“Please yourself.” 

She handed back the watch. 

Anger surged within him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov attempts to pawn a silver watch but is met with the old woman's refusal and low offer, leading to his frustration.
